back up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to say or show that what someone is saying is true
back up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Jane would back me up if she were here.
There’s no evidence to back up his accusations.
These theories have not been backed up by research.
back up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to provide support or help for someone or something
back up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The plan’s success depends on how vigorously the UN will back it up with action.
The police officers are backed up by extra teams of people at the weekend.
back up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make a copy of information stored on a computer
back up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: These devices can back up the whole system.
Back all your files up onto a storage device or Cloud.
back up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to make a vehicle move backwards
back up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The truck stopped and then backed up.
I backed the car up a little.
back up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Back up a bit so that everyone can see.
back up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: if traffic backs up, it forms a long line of vehicles that cannot move
back up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: The traffic was starting to back up in both directions.
back up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if a toilet, sink etc backs up, it becomes blocked so that water cannot flow out of it
back up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to put copies of information held on a computer onto a disk, so that the information is not lost if there is a problem with the computer
back up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: This allows users to back up the database without shutting it down.
